intro: Cephalaria gazipashensis, commonly known as the Turkish cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and clustered in a spherical shape. This species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
